thread.title: One Batch Of This Chili Equals Week's Worth Of Eating
thread.title_full: One Batch Of This Chili Equals Week's Worth Of Eating

author: Barry K
title: One Batch Of This Chili Equals Week's Worth Of Eating

organizations.name: chili equals week's worth of eating

text:
1 green pepper, seeded and diced 1 red pepper, seeded and diced 2 medium carrots, peeled and diced 2 lb ground beef, preferably grass-fed 2 Tbsp chili powder 1 can (28 oz) diced tomatoes 2 cans (15 oz each) kidney beans, drained and rinsed 2 cans (15 oz each) pinto beans, drained and rinsed 
How To Make It In a large pot, heat the olive oil on medium. Add the onions, garlic, green and red peppers, and car­rots. Cook until softened, stirring occasionally, about 2 minutes. Add the beef and cook, stirring frequently, until the meat is no longer pink, about 5 minutes. Stir in all the remaining ingredients except the beans. Bring every­­thing to a boil, adjust the heat to medium low, cover, and simmer until the liquid has reduced and the flavors meld, about 45 minutes. Stir in the beans and cook, uncovered, until the chili has thickened, another 15 minutes or so. Season with salt and freshly ground pepper to taste. Serve or store immediately. 
Makes 8 servings 
Want to transform your leftovers into other healthy meals? Try these recipes to add more flavor to your week.
